Package ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1

Assignment 1, ETS course LOG430 - Architecture logicielle.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Displays This class displays various types of information on projects and resources (individually and as lists) to the screen.
LineOfTextFileReader This class provides the methods that allow the caller to open an existing file and read one line of input (to end-of-line) from the file.
List This is the base class that is used to construct the various list objects used in this application.
Menus This class presents the user with menus, accepts their choice, ensures their choice is valid, and returns their choice to the caller.
Project This class defines the Project object for the system.
ProjectList This class is used by various other classes that need to keep a list of projects.
ProjectReader This class will read from the InputFile and instantiate the Project objects in the system.
Resource This class defines the Resource object for the system.
ResourceAssignment Main class for assignment 1 for LOG430, Architecture logicielle.
ResourceList This class is used by various other classes that need to keep a list of resources on hand.
ResourceReader Reads from the InputFile and instantiates the Resource objects in the system.
Termio This utility class contains methods that allow callers to perform various I/O operations at the command line.
 

Package ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1 Description

Assignment 1, ETS course LOG430 - Architecture logicielle. The purpose of this assignment is to introduce object-oriented implementations in the context of layered architectures.

The application is a contrived project management system. It is a menu driven system that allows the following options: 

    1) List resources (humans to be allocated to projects)
    2) List projects
    3) List projects currently assigned to a resource
    4) List resources currently assigned to a project
    5) Assign a resource to a project
    X) Exit.
Structurally, the system is roughly divided into three layers:
1) Presentation Layer
2) Business Rule Layer
3) File I/O Layer
Dynamically, the main program initializes the primary objects and dispatches commands at the user's request. When the program is started, the resource objects are initialized from a file (resources.txt is an example). The format of this file is listed in the ResourceReader class header. The project objects are initialized from another file (projects.txt is an example). The format of this file is listed in the ProjectReader class header.

Running the program:

java ResourceAssignment <ProjectDataFile> <ResourceDataFile>

With the supplied example files:

java ResourceAssignment projects.txt resources.txt

Version:
